intro: Eliokarmos dubius, commonly known as the rare desert orchid, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its unique, small, and delicate flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant thrives in arid environments, adapting to extreme temperatures and limited water availability. Its root system is highly specialized, allowing it to store water efficiently. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Eliokarmos dubius is considered a vulnerable species.
